meanings.definition: Make or become smarter or more intelligent.
meanings.sent1: Studying every day is smartening my mind.
meanings.sent2: Reading books is a great way to keep smartening yourself.
meanings.sent3: The computer thought it was smartening up by downloading more RAM.
meanings.sent4: Her curiosity about the world was smartening her understanding.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's engaging lessons were smartening the students' knowledge.

meanings.sent1: Wearing a tie can smarten up your outfit.
meanings.sent2: She decided to smarten her room by adding colorful curtains.
meanings.sent3: The cat thought wearing a bowtie would smarten its look.
meanings.sent4: The new paint job smartened the old house's appearance.
meanings.sent5: A fresh haircut can smarten up anyone's appearance.

meanings.definition: To make someone or something more efficient or effective.
meanings.sent1: Using a checklist can smarten your work process.
meanings.sent2: The new software update will smarten the system's performance.
meanings.sent3: The robot was programmed to smarten its task completion speed.
meanings.sent4: Adding more workers to the team smartened the project's progress.
meanings.sent5: Regular maintenance can smarten the machine's efficiency.
